reg_info.full_title: O. Reg. 338/96: EXEMPTION - SUBSECTION 39 (1) OF THE ACT
reg_info.citation: O. Reg. 338/96: EXEMPTION - SUBSECTION 39 (1) OF THE ACT
reg_info.act_under: Health Protection and Promotion Act   Loi sur la protection et la promotion de la santé

content.content: 1. Subsection 39 (1) of the Act does not apply to disclosure by a physician or registered nurse in the extended class, the Chief Medical Officer of Health or a medical officer of health to the Canadian Blood Services if, (a) there are reasonable grounds to believe that the person who is the subject of the disclosure has received a blood transfusion or a blood product from the Canadian Blood Services or has donated blood to the Canadian Blood Services; and (b) the application, order, certificate or report concerns, (i) Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome (AIDS), (ii) Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV), the agent of AIDS, (iii) Hepatitis C, (iv) Transmissible Spongiform Encephalopathy, including, (A) Creutzfeldt-Jakob Disease, all types, (B) Gerstmann-Sträussler-Scheinker Syndrome, (C) Fatal Familial Insomnia, and (D) Kuru, or (v) West Nile Virus Illness.  O. Reg. 103/03, s. 1; O. Reg. 412/06, s. 1; O. Reg. 421/07, s. 1.
content.raw_html:
1. Subsection 39 (1) of the Act does not apply to disclosure by a physician or registered nurse in the extended class, the Chief Medical Officer of Health or a medical officer of health to the Canadian Blood Services if,

(a) there are reasonable grounds to believe that the person who is the subject of the disclosure has received a blood transfusion or a blood product from the Canadian Blood Services or has donated blood to the Canadian Blood Services; and

(b) the application, order, certificate or report concerns,

(i) Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome (AIDS),

(ii) Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV), the agent of AIDS,

(iii) Hepatitis C,

(iv) Transmissible Spongiform Encephalopathy, including,

(A) Creutzfeldt-Jakob Disease, all types,

(B) Gerstmann-Sträussler-Scheinker Syndrome,

(C) Fatal Familial Insomnia, and

(D) Kuru, or

(v) West Nile Virus Illness.  O. Reg. 103/03, s. 1; O. Reg. 412/06, s. 1; O. Reg. 421/07, s. 1.
